title: Using the Permutation Formula
text: The permutation formula is used to calculate the number of ways to arrange $$r$$ objects out of a set of $$n$$ objects, where the order of selection matters.

hintAnswer: Cancel out the common factors in the numerator and denominator
title: Simplification
text: Expand the formula in order to simplify. How can you make 8!/4! easier to solve?
choices: Multiply 8! and 4! to get a single large number
Simplify the factorials by multiplying all numbers up to $$8$$ and $$4$$, then subtract the result
Cancel out the common factors in the numerator and denominator
Use the distributive property to break the factorials into separate parts

title: Solving Factorials
text: Recall that 8!=8*7*6*5*4!, so the the 4! terms cancel out.
